definitions.definition: A continuous deformation of one continuous function or map to another.
examples: The concept of homotopy represents a formalisation of the intuitive idea of a smooth deformation of one curve into another.

definitions.definition: The relationship between two continuous functions where homotopy from one to the other is evident.
Ellipsis of homotopy theory ( “ the systematic study of homotopies and their equivalence classes ” ) .
A theory associating a system of groups with each topological space .
A system of groups associated with a topological space.

main_definition: ( topology ) A continuous deformation of one continuous function or map to another.
secondary_definitions: ( uncountable ) The relationship between two continuous functions where homotopy from one to the other is evident.
( informal ) Ellipsis of homotopy theory ( “ the systematic study of homotopies and their equivalence classes ” ) .
( topology ) A theory associating a system of groups with each topological space .
( topology ) A system of groups associated with a topological space.
